cards.name: Allay
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target enchantment.
cards.original_text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.
cards.original_text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Cataclysm
cards.text: Each player chooses from among the permanents they control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.
cards.flavor: The Weatherlight dragged the Predator behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.
cards.original_text: Each player chooses from the permanents he or she controls an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land and sacrifices the rest.

rulings.text: If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that same permanent for more than one of the choices if you want to. This makes it possible to select an artifact creature as both your artifact and creature, and then select a land and thereby keep only two cards.

If you control a permanent with more than one type, you can choose that permanent to be the representative of either type. This makes it possible to have more than one creature (or other permanent type) on the battlefield. For example, if you select a creature for your creature and an artifact creature for your artifact, you get to keep both of these creatures.
The permanents to save are chosen on resolution. You do not choose them when casting the spell.
The current player makes their choices before the other player. After both players make choices, all the sacrifices are done simultaneously.
Each permanent not chosen by a player will be sacrificed. If a permanent has none of the listed types (for example, a Planeswalker with no other types), it can't be chosen.

cards.name: Charging Paladin
cards.text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."
cards.original_text: If Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Convalescence
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 10 or less life, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Selenia had hurt Mirri terribly, but injuries of the flesh could be treated. The wounds she had torn in Crovax's soul would never close.
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, if you have 10 or less life, gain 1 life.

rulings.text: The life total is checked when it triggers and the ability will be put on the stack only if you have 10 life or less. It checks again on resolution and does nothing if you have more life by then.

cards.name: Exalted Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Exalted Dragon can't attack unless you sacrifice a land. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)
cards.flavor: If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Each turn, Exalted Dragon cannot attack unless you sacrifice a land.

rulings.text: You have to sacrifice a land at the time you declare this creature as an attacker if you want it to attack. This is additive with any other attack costs.

cards.name: High Ground
cards.text: Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.
cards.flavor: In war, as in society, position is everything.
cards.original_text: Each creature you control may block one additional creature. (All defense must be legal.)

rulings.text: High Ground's effect is cumulative. If you have a creature that can already block an additional creature, now it can block three creatures.

High Ground allows you to make some complicated blocks. For example, if you're being attacked by three creatures (call them A, B, and C) and you control three creatures (X, Y, and Z), you can have X block A and B, Y block B and C, and Z block just C, among many other possible options. The defending player chooses how each blocking creature's combat damage will be divided among the creatures it's blocking.

cards.name: Keeper of the Light
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had more life than you did as you activated this ability. You gain 3 life.
cards.original_text: {W}, {T}: Gain 3 life. Play this ability only if you have less life than target opponent.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Kor Chant
cards.text: All damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control by a source of your choice is dealt to another target creature instead.
cards.flavor: The true treasure no thief can touch.
cards.original_text: Redirect to target creature all damage dealt to any one creature you control from any one source.

cards.name: Limited Resources
cards.text:
When Limited Resources enters the battlefield, each player chooses five lands they control and sacrifices the rest.
Players can't play lands as long as ten or more lands are on the battlefield.
cards.original_text:
When Limited Resources comes into play, each player chooses five lands he or she controls and sacrifices the rest.
As long as there are ten or more lands in play, players cannot play lands.

rulings.text: The sacrificed lands are chosen during resolution. The current player chooses first.
If a player has less than 5 lands, they get to pick and keep all of their lands.
You can put lands onto the battlefield using effects, you just can't play lands from your hand as an action.

cards.name: Oath of Lieges
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who controls more lands than they do and is their opponent. The first player may search their library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle their library.
cards.original_text: During each player's upkeep, if that player controls fewer lands than target opponent, the player may search his or her library for a basic land card and put that land into play. The player shuffles his or her library afterwards.

rulings.text: The land card enters the battlefield under the current player's control.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Shuffling the library is part of the optional effect. The player only shuffles if they chose to search.
The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player controlling more lands than the current player is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can't be targeted by this ability unless it's true, and the ability doesn't resolve if it's no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Paladin en-Vec
cards.text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)
cards.flavor: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."
cards.original_text: First strike, protection from black, protection from red

cards.name: Peace of Mind
cards.text: {W}, Discard a card: You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
Three are the paths of the soul:
One out—roam across the plain,
One back—dwell with tribe and tent,
One in—turn an enemy's hate.
cards.original_text: {W}, Choose and discard a card: Gain 3 life.

cards.name: Pegasus Stampede
cards.text:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Create a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying.
cards.original_text:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs when you play this spell. If you do, put Pegasus Stampede into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Put a Pegasus token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 white creature with flying.

cards.name: Penance
cards.text: Put a card from your hand on top of your library: The next time a black or red source of your choice would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.original_text: Choose a card from your hand and put that card on top of your library: Prevent all damage from a black or red source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)

cards.name: Reaping the Rewards
cards.text:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
You gain 2 life.
cards.original_text:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs when you play this spell. If you do, put Reaping the Rewards into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Gain 2 life.

cards.name: Reconnaissance
cards.text: {0}: Remove target attacking creature you control from combat and untap it.
cards.flavor: War favors the informed.
cards.original_text: {0}: Remove target attacking creature you control from combat and untap it. (That creature neither deals nor receives combat damage this turn.)

rulings.text: Does not undo any effects which triggered on declaration of attackers or blockers.

cards.name: Shackles
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{W}: Return Shackles to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Shackles of gold are still shackles.
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature does not untap during its controller's untap phase.
{W}: Return Shackles to owner's hand.

rulings.text: Shackles does not tap the creature when it enters the battlefield.

cards.name: Shield Mate
cards.text: Sacrifice Shield Mate: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They bear weightier burdens than the shields they carry.
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Shield Mate: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Soltari Visionary
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Visionary deals damage to a player, destroy target enchantment that player controls.
cards.original_text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
If Soltari Visionary damages any player, destroy target enchantment that player controls.

rulings.text: If the damaged player controls any enchantments, you must choose one to be destroyed. If they do not, nothing happens.

cards.name: Soul Warden
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching
cards.original_text: Whenever any other creature comes into play, gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other's ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

cards.name: Standing Troops
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.
cards.original_text: Attacking does not cause Standing Troops to tap.

cards.name: Treasure Hunter
cards.text: When Treasure Hunter enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"What separates junk from treasure is imagination."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.original_text: When Treasure Hunter comes into play, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Wall of Nets
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
At end of combat, exile all creatures blocked by Wall of Nets.
When Wall of Nets leaves the battlefield, return all cards exiled with Wall of Nets to the battlefield under their owners' control.
cards.original_text:
(Walls cannot attack.)
At end of combat, remove from the game all creatures blocked by Wall of Nets.
If Wall of Nets leaves play, return to play under their owners' control all creatures removed from the game with Wall of Nets.

rulings.text: It only exiles creatures if this card is still on the battlefield at the end of combat.

cards.name: Welkin Hawk
cards.text:
Flying
When Welkin Hawk dies, you may search your library for a card named Welkin Hawk, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text:
Flying
If Welkin Hawk is put into any graveyard from play, you may search your library for a Welkin Hawk card, reveal that card to all players, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: You do not have to find a Welkin Hawk card if you do not want to.

cards.name: Zealots en-Dal
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if all nonland permanents you control are white, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Great chains shall free our warriors."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, if all nonland permanents you control are white, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Aether Tide
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard X creature cards.
Return X target creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: The tide of magic brought them here. Now it would take them home.
cards.original_text: Choose and discard X creature cards: Return X target creatures to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Cunning
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature attacks or blocks, sacrifice Cunning at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
cards.flavor:
". . . Dry-walkers die
We feed on sweet flesh . . . ."
—Rootwater Saga
cards.original_text:
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
If enchanted creature attacks or blocks, sacrifice Cunning at end of turn.

cards.name: Curiosity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.
cards.original_text: If enchanted creature damages an opponent, you may draw a card.

rulings.text: "You" refers to the controller of Curiosity, which may be different from the controller of the enchanted creature. "An opponent" refers to an opponent of Curiosity's controller.
Any damage dealt by the enchanted creature to an opponent will cause Curiosity to trigger, not just combat damage.
Curiosity doesn't trigger if the enchanted creature deals damage to a planeswalker controlled by an opponent.
You draw one card each time the enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, no matter how much damage it deals or whether it was dealt in combat.
If this Aura enchants an opponent's creature, you won't draw a card when that creature damages you. The creature has to deal damage to one of your opponents for the ability to trigger.

cards.name: Dominating Licid
cards.text:
{1}{U}{U}, {T}: Dominating Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.
You control enchanted creature.
cards.original_text: {1}{U}{U}, {T}: Dominating Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "Gain control of enchanted creature" instead of any other type of permanent. Move Dominating Licid onto target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.

rulings.text: It becomes an Enchantment - Aura and stops being all other permanent types.
Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

cards.name: Ephemeron
cards.text:
Flying
Discard a card: Return Ephemeron to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: From nothing came teeth.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Choose and discard a card: Return Ephemeron to owner's hand.

cards.name: Equilibrium
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: In Rath, there are only so many souls to go around.
cards.original_text: Whenever you successfully cast a creature spell, you may pay {1} to return target creature to owner's hand.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.
The ability is put on the stack immediately after you cast a creature spell, which means the creature that spell will become won't be a legal target.
The ability will still resolve even if the spell that triggered it gets countered.

cards.name: Ertai, Wizard Adept
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor:
"Was that it?"
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.original_text:
Ertai, Wizard Adept counts as a Wizard.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Counter target spell. Play this ability as an interrupt.

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

cards.name: Fade Away
cards.text: For each creature, its controller sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {1}.
cards.flavor:
"Consider the fable of the greedy herder. As her flock grew, so did her weariness; she slept, and the sheep wandered off."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.original_text: For each creature, that creature's controller pays {1} or sacrifices a permanent.

rulings.text: At the beginning of the resolution, each player counts up the number of creatures they control, then they make the required number of payments and/or sacrifices. The active player announces their choices first followed by the other players, but all the sacrifices are done at the same time. Because of this, you can't sacrifice one creature in order to pay for another and thereby avoid payment for the first.
You can choose to pay some mana and sacrifice some permanents if you have more than one creature.
You can activate mana abilities during the resolution if you decide to pay mana.

cards.name: Forbid
cards.text:
Buyback—Discard two cards. (You may discard two cards in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Counter target spell.
cards.original_text:
Buyback—Choose and discard two cards. (You may choose and discard two cards in addition to any other costs when you play this spell. If you do, put Forbid into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Counter target spell.

cards.name: Keeper of the Mind
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had at least two more cards in hand than you did as you activated this ability. Draw a card.
cards.original_text: {U}, {T}: Draw a card. Play this ability only if target opponent has at least two more cards in hand than you.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Killer Whale
cards.text: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.
cards.original_text: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Mana Breach
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land they control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The wizard had it all—until she tried to use it.
cards.original_text: Whenever any player plays a spell, that player returns a land he or she controls to owner's hand.

rulings.text: The ability itself is controlled by Mana Breach's controller.
The person who cast the spell chooses which of their lands is affected.

cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: In the depths of Rootwater, salvage and sewage differ only in texture.
cards.original_text: {T}: Draw a card, then choose and discard a card.

rulings.text: You can't do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

cards.name: Mind Over Matter
cards.text: Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor:
Lyna turned to the figure beside her. "They're gone. What now?"
"As ever," said Urza, "we wait."
cards.original_text: Choose and discard a card: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Mirozel
cards.text:
Flying
When Mirozel becomes the target of a spell or ability, return Mirozel to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The mirozels are the only stars in Rath's opaque skies.
cards.original_text:
Flying
If Mirozel is the target of any spell or ability, return Mirozel to owner's hand.

rulings.text: Triggers on a spell or ability being changed to target this card.
Triggers on any spell or ability being announced which targets this card. This means it returns to owner's hand before that spell resolves.

cards.name: Oath of Scholars
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who has more cards in hand than they do and is their opponent. The first player may discard their hand and draw three cards.
cards.original_text: During each player's upkeep, if that player has fewer cards in hand than target opponent, the player may discard his or her hand and draw three cards.

rulings.text: The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player having more cards in their hand than the current player is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can't be targeted by this ability unless it's true, and the ability doesn't resolve if it's no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Robe of Mirrors
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: "Does this make me look fat?"
cards.original_text: Enchanted creature cannot be the target of spells or abilities.

rulings.text: Having shroud will prevent the creature from being targeted by Aura spells, but it does not remove any Auras that are already attached to the creature or stop Auras from being moved to the creature by some other method.

cards.name: Rootwater Mystic
cards.text: {1}{U}: Look at the top card of target player's library.
cards.flavor:
"Read the roots    tell the tale
Future forms    in waving weeds
Higher than truth   is hope."
—Rootwater Saga
cards.original_text: {1}{U}: Look at the top card of target player's library.

cards.name: School of Piranha
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice School of Piranha unless you pay {1}{U}.
cards.flavor: Some schools aren't worth getting into.
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, pay {1}{U} or sacrifice School of Piranha.

cards.name: Scrivener
cards.text: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"History is a potent weapon."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.original_text: When Scrivener comes into play, you may return target instant or interrupt card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Thalakos Drifters
cards.text: Discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor: They drift in and out of shadow and ever on toward madness.
cards.original_text: Choose and discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

rulings.text: The reminder text is only accurate when this card has Shadow.

cards.name: Thalakos Scout
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Discard a card: Return Thalakos Scout to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Choose and discard a card: Return Thalakos Scout to owner's hand.

cards.name: Theft of Dreams
cards.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor:
"Volrath stole everything there was of me."
—Takara
cards.original_text: For each tapped creature target opponent controls, draw a card.

cards.name: Treasure Trove
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Karn and Hanna stood over the recovered Legacy artifacts like loving parents over sleeping children.
cards.original_text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Wayward Soul
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Put Wayward Soul on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"no home    no heart    no hope"
—Stronghold graffito
cards.original_text:
Flying
{U}: Put Wayward Soul on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Whiptongue Frog
cards.text: {U}: Whiptongue Frog gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Their favorite food? Wind dancers.
cards.original_text: {U}: Whiptongue Frog gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Carnophage
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.
cards.flavor: Eating is all it knows.
cards.original_text: During your upkeep, pay 1 life or tap Carnophage.

cards.name: Cat Burglar
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: The il-Kor no longer roam the open plains, but they are still hunters.
cards.original_text: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player chooses and discards a card. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Culling the Weak
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add {B}{B}{B}{B}.
cards.flavor:
"The blood of the weak shall be the ink with which we scribe great Yawgmoth's glorious name."
—Stronghold architect, journal
cards.original_text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: You sacrifice a creature when casting the spell and you can't sacrifice more than one creature to get extra mana.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.name: Cursed Flesh
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . . .
cards.original_text: Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and cannot be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.

cards.name: Dauthi Cutthroat
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with shadow.
cards.flavor: In their twisted logic, to empty the shadow world is to escape it.
cards.original_text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with shadow.

cards.name: Dauthi Jackal
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{B}{B}, Sacrifice Dauthi Jackal: Destroy target blocking creature.
cards.flavor:
"All Dauthi are jackals, regardless of breed."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary
cards.original_text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{B}{B}, Sacrifice Dauthi Jackal: Destroy target blocking creature.

rulings.text: This creature does not have to be an attacker or blocker to use its ability.

cards.name: Dauthi Warlord
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Warlord's power is equal to the number of creatures with shadow on the battlefield.
cards.original_text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Warlord has power equal to the number of creatures with shadow in play.

rulings.text: Dauthi Warlord counts creatures with the Shadow ability controlled by all players.

cards.name: Death's Duet
cards.text: Return two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.
cards.original_text: Return two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Entropic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
As Entropic Specter enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Entropic Specter's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in the chosen player's hand.
Whenever Entropic Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Entropic Specter has power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in target opponent's hand.
If Entropic Specter damages any player, that player chooses and discards a card.

rulings.text: The opponent does not discard a card if all the damage is prevented.

You choose one opposing player during resolution and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes 0/0 if the chosen player leaves the game.

cards.name: Fugue
cards.text: Target player discards three cards.
cards.flavor: "My ship . . . ," Sisay mumbled. "Intact," Gerrard reassured her, "which is more than I can say for you, my friend." Sisay laughed despite the pain.
cards.original_text: Target player chooses and discards three cards.

cards.name: Grollub
cards.text: Whenever Grollub is dealt damage, each opponent gains that much life.
cards.flavor: Mogglings caught in a misdeed often blame the grollub. Even though the creature is usually innocent, no taskmaster can resist an excuse to beat it.
cards.original_text: For each 1 damage dealt to Grollub, each opponent gains 1 life.

cards.name: Hatred
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I will flay the skin from your flesh and the flesh from your bones and scrape your bones dry. And still you will not have suffered enough."
—Greven il-Vec, to Gerrard
cards.original_text: Pay X life: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The life payment is part of the cost to cast Hatred, so it is lost if this spell is countered.

cards.name: Keeper of the Dead
cards.text: {B}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had at least two fewer creature cards in their graveyard than you did as you activated this ability. Destroy target nonblack creature that player controls.
cards.original_text: {B}, {T}: Destroy target nonblack creature. Play this ability only if that creature's controller has at least two fewer creature cards in his or her graveyard than you have in yours.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Mind Maggots
cards.text: When Mind Maggots enters the battlefield, discard any number of creature cards. For each card discarded this way, put two +1/+1 counters on Mind Maggots.
cards.original_text: When Mind Maggots comes into play, choose and discard any number of creature cards. For each card discarded this way, put two +1/+1 counters on Mind Maggots.

rulings.text: You can choose to discard zero creature cards.

cards.name: Nausea
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Any mogg will tell you there's nothing more nauseating than the smell of cute.
cards.original_text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: All creatures on the battlefield when Nausea resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

cards.name: Necrologia
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during your end step.
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Draw X cards.
cards.flavor:
"My enemies' death yields threefold benefit: removal, reuse, and research."
—Volrath
cards.original_text:
Play Necrologia only during your discard phase.
Pay X life: Draw X cards.

rulings.text: This spell is cast during the End step. Since you discard down to 7 cards in the cleanup step, this card is used before the discard.

cards.name: Oath of Ghouls
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player whose graveyard has fewer creature cards in it than their graveyard does and is their opponent. The first player may return a creature card from their graveyard to their hand.
cards.original_text: During each player's upkeep, if there are more creature cards in that player's graveyard than in target opponent's graveyard, the player may return a creature card from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.

rulings.text: The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player's graveyard having fewer creature cards in it than the current player's is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can't be targeted by this ability unless it's true, and the ability doesn't resolve if it's no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Pit Spawn
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Pit Spawn unless you pay {B}{B}.
Whenever Pit Spawn deals damage to a creature, exile that creature.
cards.original_text:
First strike
During your upkeep, pay {B}{B} or sacrifice Pit Spawn.
If Pit Spawn damages any creature, remove that creature from the game.

rulings.text: Since this card has First Strike it will often deal damage during first strike damage dealing and its ability will exile the creature it damages before that creature can deal damage back.

cards.name: Plaguebearer
cards.text: {X}{X}{B}: Destroy target nonblack creature with converted mana cost X.
cards.flavor: Its respiration is your expiration.
cards.original_text: {X}{X}{B}: Destroy target nonblack creature with total casting cost equal to X.

cards.name: Recurring Nightmare
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature, Return Recurring Nightmare to its owner's hand: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor:
"I am confined by sleep and defined by nightmare."
—Crovax
cards.original_text: Sacrifice a creature, Return Recurring Nightmare to owner's hand: Put target creature card from your graveyard into play. Play this ability as a sorcery.

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

cards.name: Scare Tactics
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Fear rules those weak enough to accept it."
—Greven il-Vec
cards.original_text: All creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Slaughter
cards.text:
Buyback—Pay 4 life. (You may pay 4 life in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.original_text:
Buyback—Pay 4 life. (You may pay 4 life in addition to any other costs when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Destroy target nonblack creature. That creature cannot be regenerated this turn.

rulings.text: You can't pay the buyback if you have less than 4 life, even if an effect would keep you from losing for having 0 or less life.

cards.name: Spike Cannibal
cards.text:
Spike Cannibal enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
When Spike Cannibal enters the battlefield, move all +1/+1 counters from all creatures onto it.
cards.original_text:
Spike Cannibal comes into play with one +1/+1 counter on it.
When Spike Cannibal comes into play, move all +1/+1 counters from all creatures onto Spike Cannibal.

rulings.text: It will move its own +1/+1 counter onto itself, but it does not die during this move since it never is without a counter at a time when State-Based Actions are checked.

cards.name: Thrull Surgeon
cards.text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Thrull Surgeon: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "Just take a little off the top."
cards.original_text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Thrull Surgeon: Look at target player's hand and choose one of those cards. That player discards that card. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Vampire Hounds
cards.text: Discard a creature card: Vampire Hounds gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The hounds' barks are a horrifying chorus of screams, moans, and whispers.
cards.original_text: Choose and discard a creature card: Vampire Hounds gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Volrath's Dungeon
cards.text:
Pay 5 life: Destroy Volrath's Dungeon. Any player may activate this ability but only during their turn.
Discard a card: Target player puts a card from their hand on top of their library. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.original_text:
Any player may pay 5 life during his or her turn to destroy Volrath's Dungeon.
Choose and discard a card: Target player chooses a card in his or her hand and puts that card on top of his or her library. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Anarchist
cards.text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "I'll take that. You won't need it when the revolution comes."
cards.original_text: When Anarchist comes into play, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Cinder Crawler
cards.text: {R}: Cinder Crawler gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if Cinder Crawler is blocked.
cards.flavor: The crawler doesn't care what gets in its way. It pushes everything into the boiling muck and waits for the meal to cook.
cards.original_text: {R}: Cinder Crawler gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Use this ability only if Cinder Crawler is blocked.

cards.name: Dizzying Gaze
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
{R}: Enchanted creature deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"When I cut down my angel I only started my fall."
—Crovax
cards.original_text:
Play Dizzying Gaze only on a creature you control.
{R}: Enchanted creature deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

rulings.text: Dizzying Gaze can't be cast targeting an opponent's creature. And this card is put into the graveyard if ever on a creature you do not control.

cards.name: Fighting Chance
cards.text: For each blocking creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by that creature this turn.
cards.flavor: A stroke of luck can smite an army.
cards.original_text: For each blocking creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, that creature deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Flowstone Flood
cards.text:
Buyback—Pay 3 life, Discard a card at random. (You may pay 3 life and discard a card at random in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target land.
cards.original_text:
Buyback—Pay 3 life, Discard a card at random. (You may pay 3 life and discard a card at random in addition to any other costs when you play this spell. If you do, put Flowstone Flood into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Destroy target land.

rulings.text: You can't pay the Buyback cost unless you have at least one card in your hand to discard.

cards.name: Furnace Brood
cards.text: {R}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
cards.flavor: Furnace air crackles with magmatic cackles.
cards.original_text: {R}: Target creature cannot be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Keeper of the Flame
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had more life than you did as you activated this ability. Keeper of the Flame deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.original_text: {R}, {T}: Keeper of the Flame deals 2 damage to target opponent. Use this ability only if that opponent has more life than you.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Mage il-Vec
cards.text: {T}, Discard a card at random: Mage il-Vec deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Living below a flowstone foundry produces a disproportionate number of fire mages among the il.
cards.original_text: {T}, Discard a card at random: Mage il-Vec deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: You must discard a card as part of the activation cost. You can't announce the ability unless you have a card in hand.

cards.name: Maniacal Rage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
cards.flavor: Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
cards.original_text: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and cannot block.

cards.name: Mogg Assassin
cards.text: {T}: You choose target creature an opponent controls, and that opponent chooses target creature. Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy the creature you chose. If you lose the flip, destroy the creature your opponent chose.
cards.original_text: {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target creature an opponent controls. Otherwise, destroy target creature of that opponent's choice.

rulings.text: You and your opponent both pick the target creatures on announcing, which is before the coin is flipped. You pick first.

cards.name: Monstrous Hound
cards.text:
Monstrous Hound can't attack unless you control more lands than defending player.
Monstrous Hound can't block unless you control more lands than attacking player.
cards.flavor: "Stay."
cards.original_text:
Monstrous Hound cannot attack unless you control more lands than defending player.
Monstrous Hound cannot block unless you control more lands than attacking player.

cards.name: Oath of Mages
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who has more life than they do and is their opponent. The first player may have Oath of Mages deal 1 damage to the second player.
cards.original_text: During each player's upkeep, if that player has less life than target opponent, he or she may have Oath of Mages deal 1 damage to that opponent.

rulings.text: The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player having more life than the current player is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can't be targeted by this ability unless it's true, and the ability doesn't resolve if it's no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Ogre Shaman
cards.text: {2}, Discard a card at random: Ogre Shaman deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Ogre shamans must be bright enough to learn their invocations and dim enough to use them.
cards.original_text: {2}, Discard a card at random: Ogre Shaman deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Onslaught
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, tap target creature.
cards.flavor: The last thing to go through the mogg's mind was its teeth.
cards.original_text: Whenever you successfully cast a creature spell, tap target creature.

rulings.text: Can target an already tapped creature.
The ability is not optional. If you have the only targetable creatures, you have to tap one of your own.
A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.name: Pandemonium
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to any target of their choice.
cards.flavor:
"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.original_text: Whenever any creature comes into play, that creature's controller may choose to have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

rulings.text: The triggered ability does not check the creature's power until the ability resolves. If the creature is not on the battlefield when the ability resolves, it does damage equal to the power of the creature right before it left the battlefield. This means that if a creature enters the battlefield which can destroy itself as a "enters the battlefield" ability, the order of resolution of the triggered abilities does not matter.

If player A controls Pandemonium when a creature enters the battlefield under player B's control, player A controls the triggered ability even though player B chooses the target and chooses whether to have the creature deal damage, which could be important if multiple abilities controlled by multiple players trigger.

cards.name: Paroxysm
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player reveals the top card of their library. If that card is a land card, destroy that creature. Otherwise, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.original_text: During the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, reveal the top card of that player's library to all players. If that card is a land card, destroy enchanted creature. Otherwise, enchanted creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. (Return the card to the top of the player's library, face down.)

rulings.text: The ability is not optional.

cards.name: Price of Progress
cards.text: Price of Progress deals damage to each player equal to twice the number of nonbasic lands that player controls.
cards.flavor: Man versus nature is not a fair fight.
cards.original_text: Price of Progress deals 2 damage to each player for each nonbasic land he or she controls.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: Volrath has bred them to fear only him. Are they charging into battle, or merely fleeing his wrath?
cards.original_text: Raging Goblin is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Ravenous Baboons
cards.text: When Ravenous Baboons enters the battlefield, destroy target nonbasic land.
cards.flavor: Build something and the baboons will tear it down. Leave the pieces lying and they will scatter them.
cards.original_text: When Ravenous Baboons comes into play, destroy target nonbasic land.

rulings.text: If there is no non-basic land to destroy, the ability does nothing.
You have to pick one of your own non-basic lands if the opponent does not have any and you do.

cards.name: Reckless Ogre
cards.text: Whenever Reckless Ogre attacks alone, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: There is no such thing as a regiment of ogres.
cards.original_text: If Reckless Ogre attacks and no other creatures do, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sabertooth Wyvern
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor: Most creatures grow out of their baby teeth, but sabertooth wyverns grow into theirs.
cards.original_text: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Scalding Salamander
cards.text: Whenever Scalding Salamander attacks, you may have it deal 1 damage to each creature without flying defending player controls.
cards.original_text: {0}: Scalding Salamander deals 1 damage to each creature without flying defending player controls. Play this ability only if Scalding Salamander is attacking and only once each turn.

rulings.text: The ability triggers on the declaration of attackers and will resolve before blockers are declared.

cards.name: Seismic Assault
cards.text: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The flowstone seemed for a moment to assume Greven's rage—it lunged like a wild beast at the Weatherlight.
cards.original_text: Choose and discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shattering Pulse
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target artifact.
cards.original_text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Sonic Burst
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card at random.
Sonic Burst deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Music scythes the savage beast.
cards.original_text: Discard a card at random: Sonic Burst deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: You can't discard more than once to target more than one creature (or player) or to do multiple amounts of damage to a single creature (or player).
You pick the target before you know which card is going to be discarded.

cards.name: Spellshock
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Spellshock deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: A snap of fingers, a snap of teeth.
cards.original_text: Whenever any player successfully casts a spell, Spellshock deals 2 damage to him or her.

rulings.text: It affects all players, including you.

cards.name: Avenging Druid
cards.text: Whenever Avenging Druid deals damage to an opponent, you may reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a land card. If you do, put that card onto the battlefield and put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.
cards.original_text: If Avenging Druid damages any opponent, you may reveal cards from your library until you reveal a land card. Put that land into play and put all other revealed cards into your graveyard.

rulings.text: The ability does not work if all damage is prevented.
Putting a land onto the battlefield does not count as playing a land.

cards.name: Bequeathal
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, you draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"On my death, I give you this treasure: the knowledge that life is hard, yet too soon past."
—Dal funeral rite
cards.original_text: If enchanted creature is put into any graveyard, draw two cards.

cards.name: Cartographer
cards.text: When Cartographer enters the battlefield, you may return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: How do you map a world when the land moves beneath your feet?
cards.original_text: When Cartographer comes into play, you may return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Crashing Boars
cards.text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature they control. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.
cards.flavor: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
cards.original_text: If Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature he or she controls. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is not still untapped at the time blockers are declared, it does not have to block.
The ability is not optional. If there are no untapped creatures to choose, then the ability does nothing.

cards.name: Elven Palisade
cards.text: Sacrifice a Forest: Target attacking creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Volrath is not the only one who can shape this world to serve him."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.original_text: Sacrifice a forest: Target attacking creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Elvish Berserker
cards.text: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.flavor: Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.
cards.original_text: For each creature that blocks it, Elvish Berserker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Jackalope Herd
cards.text: When you cast a spell, return Jackalope Herd to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: There's little more demeaning than getting your butt kicked by a bunch of bunnies.
cards.original_text: If you play any spell, return Jackalope Herd to owner's hand.

rulings.text: It will only return if it is still on the battlefield when the triggered ability resolves.

cards.name: Keeper of the Beasts
cards.text: {G}, {T}: Choose target opponent who controlled more creatures than you did as you activated this ability. Create a 2/2 green Beast creature token.
cards.original_text: {G}, {T}: Put a Beast token into play. Treat this token as a 2/2 green creature. Play this ability only if target opponent controls more creatures than you.

rulings.text: A different opposing player may be targeted each time the ability is activated.
It is only necessary that the condition be true as you activate the ability. The ability will still resolve normally even if the condition is no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Manabond
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, you may reveal your hand and put all land cards from it onto the battlefield. If you do, discard your hand.
cards.original_text: During your discard phase, you may choose to put all land cards from your hand into play. If you do, discard the rest of your hand.

rulings.text: The lands are put onto the battlefield during the resolution of the ability.
You discard all the cards still in your hand after you put the lands onto the battlefield.
Putting a land onto the battlefield does not count as playing a land.

cards.name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
cards.text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.original_text:
Mirri, Cat Warrior counts as a Cat Warrior.
First strike; forestwalk (If defending player controls any forests, this creature is unblockable.)
Attacking does not cause Mirri to tap.

cards.name: Oath of Druids
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who controls more creatures than they do and is their opponent. The first player may reveal cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. If the first player does, that player puts that card onto the battlefield and all other cards revealed this way into their graveyard.
cards.original_text: During each player's upkeep, if that player controls fewer creatures than target opponent, the player may reveal cards from his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that creature into play and all other revealed cards into his or her graveyard.

rulings.text: The ability can only target an opponent of the current player.

The targeted player controlling more creatures than the current player is a part of the targeting requirement. A player can't be targeted by this ability unless it's true, and the ability doesn't resolve if it's no longer true at that time.

cards.name: Plated Rootwalla
cards.text: {2}{G}: Plated Rootwalla gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
" . . . And the third little boar built his house out of rootwalla plates . . . ."
—Skyshroud children's story
cards.original_text: {2}{G}: Plated Rootwalla gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

rulings.text: If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

cards.name: Predatory Hunger
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: Hunger growls, never purrs.
cards.original_text: Whenever any opponent successfully casts a creature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.name: Pygmy Troll
cards.text:
Whenever Pygmy Troll becomes blocked by a creature, Pygmy Troll gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{G}: Regenerate Pygmy Troll.
cards.flavor: "Who you callin' 'shorty'?"
cards.original_text:
For each creature that blocks it, Pygmy Troll gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{G}: Regenerate Pygmy Troll.

cards.name: Rabid Wolverines
cards.text: Whenever Rabid Wolverines becomes blocked by a creature, Rabid Wolverines gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Is there any other kind?
cards.original_text: For each creature that blocks it, Rabid Wolverines gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Reclaim
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
cards.original_text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Resuscitate
cards.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "{1}: Regenerate this creature."
cards.flavor:
"It is the art of convincing someone to live."
—Orim, Samite healer
cards.original_text: Until end of turn, each creature you control gains "{1}: Regenerate this creature."

rulings.text: Only grants the ability to creatures you control when this spell resolves. Ones entering the battlefield later in the turn do not get it.

cards.name: Rootwater Alligator
cards.text: Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Rootwater Alligator.
cards.flavor: Subduing and skinning an alligator is the first rite of maturity adolescent merfolk must pass.
cards.original_text: Sacrifice a forest: Regenerate Rootwater Alligator.

cards.name: Skyshroud Elite
cards.text: Skyshroud Elite gets +1/+2 as long as an opponent controls a nonbasic land.
cards.flavor:
"Civilization is a conspiracy to disguise the mutilation of nature."
—Skyshroud elite creed
cards.original_text: Skyshroud Elite gets +1/+2 as long as any opponent controls any nonbasic lands.

cards.name: Skyshroud War Beast
cards.text:
Trample
As Skyshroud War Beast enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Skyshroud War Beast's power and toughness are each equal to the number of nonbasic lands the chosen player controls.
cards.original_text:
Trample
Skyshroud War Beast has power and toughness each equal to the number of nonbasic lands target opponent controls.

rulings.text: The power and toughness are continuously recalculated.

cards.name: Song of Serenity
cards.text: Creatures that are enchanted can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: Heartwood brings peace in great symphonies where dryads conduct the trees through every note.
cards.original_text: Creatures with any enchantments on them cannot attack or block.

cards.name: Spike Hatcher
cards.text:
Spike Hatcher enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Hatcher: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Hatcher: Regenerate Spike Hatcher.
cards.original_text:
Spike Hatcher comes into play with six +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Hatcher: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Hatcher: Regenerate Spike Hatcher.

cards.name: Spike Rogue
cards.text:
Spike Rogue enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Rogue: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: Put a +1/+1 counter on Spike Rogue.
cards.original_text:
Spike Rogue comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Rogue: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from any creature you control: Put a +1/+1 counter on Spike Rogue.

cards.name: Spike Weaver
cards.text:
Spike Weaver enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.original_text:
Spike Weaver comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Creatures deal no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: The second ability includes your own creatures as well.

cards.name: Survival of the Fittest
cards.text: {G}, Discard a creature card: Search your library for a creature card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.original_text: {G}, Choose and discard a creature card: Search your library for a creature card, reveal that card to all players, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Secure in the embrace of wood, they want no part of Eladamri's war.
cards.original_text: When Wood Elves comes into play, search your library for a forest card and put that forest into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
cards.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march
cards.original_text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature in play of the same creature type. (For example, if there are three Goblins in play, each of them gets +2/+2.)

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

cards.name: Erratic Portal
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"
cards.original_text: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.name: Medicine Bag
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor:
"My medicine bag and I have treated countless wounds and illnesses. But never have I seen so many made so sick for so long. We will never eat Squee's cooking again."
—Orim, journal
cards.original_text: {1}, {T}, Choose and discard a card: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Memory Crystal
cards.text: Buyback costs cost {2} less.
cards.flavor: Hues of recollection flicker like facets of a gem.
cards.original_text: All buyback costs are reduced by {2}.

rulings.text: Can't reduce the cost below zero.
Does not apply to other parts of the cost.
Only affects generic mana portions of Buyback costs.
It applies to all players.
The ability is not optional.

cards.name: Mindless Automaton
cards.text:
Mindless Automaton enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.
cards.original_text:
Mindless Automaton comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Choose and discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.

cards.name: Null Brooch
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Discard your hand: Counter target noncreature spell.
cards.flavor:
Give away everything so others have nothing.
—Brooch inscription
cards.original_text: {2}, {T}, Discard your hand: Counter target noncreature spell. Play this ability as an interrupt.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.name: Skyshaper
cards.text: Sacrifice Skyshaper: Creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It'll get us to the portal, but I can't guarantee what it'll do to the ship."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Skyshaper: All creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: You have no maximum hand size.
cards.flavor:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.original_text: Skip your discard phase.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.name: Sphere of Resistance
cards.text: Spells cost {1} more to cast.
cards.flavor: A sphere pushes equally in all directions.
cards.original_text: All spells cost an additional {1} to play.

rulings.text: It affects all players, including you.

cards.name: Thopter Squadron
cards.text:
Flying
Thopter Squadron enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Thopter Squadron: Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
{1}, Sacrifice another Thopter: Put a +1/+1 counter on Thopter Squadron. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Thopter Squadron comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Thopter Squadron: Put a Thopter token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 artifact creature with flying. Play this ability as a sorcery.
{1}, Sacrifice a Thopter: Put a +1/+1 counter on Thopter Squadron. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Transmogrifying Licid
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Transmogrifying Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {1} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and is an artifact in addition to its other types.
cards.original_text:
Transmogrifying Licid counts as a Licid.
{1}, {T}: Transmogrifying Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and counts as an artifact" instead of any other type of permanent. Move Transmogrifying Licid onto target creature. You may pay {1} to end this effect.

rulings.text: If the permanent it is on was only a creature due to an effect, when that effect ends, the Licid will find itself enchanting something illegal and be put into the graveyard.
The enchanted creature gains the artifact type in addition to any other card types it may already have.
Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

When the activated ability resolves, Transmogrifying Licid becomes an Aura enchantment and ceases to be either a creature or an artifact. Since it is no longer a creature, it also loses the creature type Licid. When the effect is ended, it goes back to being an artifact creature with the creature type Licid and ceases to be an Aura enchantment.

cards.name: Workhorse
cards.text:
Workhorse enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Workhorse: Add {C}.
cards.original_text:
Workhorse comes into play with four +1/+1 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Workhorse: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: City of Traitors
cards.text:
When you play another land, sacrifice City of Traitors.
{T}: Add {C}{C}.
cards.flavor:
"While we fought, the il surrendered."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.original_text:
If you play a land, sacrifice City of Traitors.
{T}: Add two colorless mana to your mana pool.

rulings.text: City of Traitors does not trigger on lands that are put onto the battlefield without playing them.
City of Traitors does not trigger on itself being played.
